page.title: 10Local Mayor
page.content: {Q. Recently many shops in the town {have changed ownership or closed. What {do you think are the main reasons? } A. This is related to the change in our shopping practices. We're now accustomed to self-service stores and supermarkets, whereas 30 years ago a grocer would call upon you, take your order and deliver your goods. There used to be 10 or 12 shops and now we only have 2, both supermarkets. {Q. Are there any special annual events {in Pocklington?} A. There's the Pocklington Rugby 7's on Good Friday; at Christmas we have celebrations round the Christmas Tree in the Market Place; and the annual carnival market is a great success attracting many people to Pocklington in August. Next year we hope to revive an annual arts festival which we held successfully for a number of years.
